name: BlackTech (G0098)
description: Enterprise techniques used by BlackTech, ATT&CK group G0098 v1.0

techniques.comment: [BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) has exploited a buffer overflow vulnerability in Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) 6.0, CVE-2017-7269, in order to establish a new HTTP or command and control (C2) server.(Citation: TrendMicro BlackTech June 2017)

[BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) has exploited multiple vulnerabilities for execution, including Microsoft Office vulnerabilities CVE-2012-0158, CVE-2014-6352, CVE-2017-0199, and Adobe Flash CVE-2015-5119.
BlackTech group has exploited a vulnerable update mechanism in ASUS WebStorage software in order to deploy Plead malware in some networks.
ESET May 2019
[BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) has used right-to-left-override to obfuscate the filenames of malicious e-mail attachments.(Citation: TrendMicro BlackTech June 2017)
[BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) has used spearphishing e-mails with links to cloud services to deliver malware.(Citation: TrendMicro BlackTech June 2017)
[BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) has used spearphishing e-mails with malicious documents to deliver malware.(Citation: TrendMicro BlackTech June 2017)
[BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) has used e-mails with malicious links to lure victims into installing malware.(Citation: TrendMicro BlackTech June 2017)
[BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) has used e-mails with malicious documents to lure victims into installing malware.(Citation: TrendMicro BlackTech June 2017)

Plead malware uses HTTP for communication with its C&C.
ESET May 2019

Plead malware might drop a second stage loader in the Start Menu's startup folder.
ESET May 2019

Plead malware might drop a second stage loader in the Start Menu's startup folder.
ESET May 2019

Some Plead malware samples are signed with stolen certificates.
Citation: ESET May 2019

Data exfiltration is done using the already opened channel with the C&C server.
ESET May 2019

Plead malware allows attackers to obtain a list of files.
ESET May 2019

Plead malware allows attackers to upload and download files from its C&C.
ESET May 2019

Plead malware encrypts its payloads with the RC4 algorithm.
Citation: ESET May 2019

Plead malware allows attackers to obtain a list of running processes on a system.
ESET May 2019

BlackTech can deploy a module that steals credentials from the victim's browser and email clients.
ESET May 2019
